Issues.Title: refactor(compiler): parse bindings "by hand" rather than via regex
Issues.Body:
To support recovery of malformed binding property names like `([a)`,
`[a`, or `()`, the binding parser needs to be more permissive w.r.t. the
kinds of bindings it can detect. This is difficult to do maintainably
with a regex, but is trivial with a "hand-rolled" string parser. This
commit refactors render3's binding attribute parsing to use this method
for multi-delimited bindings (namely via the `()`, `[]`, and `[()]`)
syntax, making the way recovery of malformed bindings in a future patch.

Note that we can keep using a regex for prefix-only binding syntax
(e.g. `bind-`, `ref-`) because validation of the binding is complete
once we have matched the prefix, and the only thing left to do is check
that the binding identifier is non-empty, which is trivial.

Part of #38596

Issues.Title: ci(angular/dev-infra): add CI checks to ensure `lock-closed` action is built correctly
Issues.Body:
**The problem**

Currently, the [angular/dev-infra](https://github.com/angular/dev-infra) repository relies on a [pre-commit git hook][1] for building the `lock-closed` action, in order to ensure that the changes made in the source code (e.g. [src/main.ts][2]) will also be included in the built script that is actually used when running the action (i.e. [lib/bundle.js][3]).

However, it is easy to miss this step (for example if someone submit a PR via the GitHub UI or commits review suggestions via the GitHub UI or has git hooks disabled, etc.).

This can result in issues such as #39358, where the fix is in the source code but not in the built script (that is actually used).

##
**The solution**

Introduce CI checks to `angular/dev-infra` that would ensure that the built script (`lib/bundle.js`) is indeed up-to-date with the source code (`src/main.ts`).

[1]: https://github.com/angular/dev-infra/blob/414834b2b24dd2df37c6ed00808387ee6fd91b66/scripts/pre-commit.sh#L5
[2]: https://github.com/angular/dev-infra/blob/414834b2b24dd2df37c6ed00808387ee6fd91b66/github-actions/lock-closed/src/main.ts#L35
[3]: https://github.com/angular/dev-infra/blob/414834b2b24dd2df37c6ed00808387ee6fd91b66/github-actions/lock-closed/lib/bundle.js#L26099
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ci(angular/dev-infra): add CI checks to ensure `lock-closed` action is built correctly" (#39372)

Issues.Title: [docs-infra] Update angular.io deployments to match new versioning/branching process
Issues.Body:
This issue is for tracking progress on updating angular.io deployments to match our [new versioning/branching process](https://docs.google.com/document/d/197kVillDwx-RZtSVOBtPb4BBIAw0E9RT3q3v6DZkykU). ## Planning 1. **What Firebase projects/sites need to be created?** - [x] `angular-io > v2-angular-io-site` - [x] `angular-io > v4-angular-io-site` - [x] `angular-io > v5-angular-io-site` - [x] `angular-io > v6-angular-io-site` - [x] `angular-io > v7-angular-io-site` - [x] `angular-io > v8-angular-io-site` - [x] `angular-io > v9-angular-io-site` - [x] `angular-io > v10-angular-io-site` - [x] `angular-io > v11-angular-io-site` - [x] `angular-io > rc-angular-io-site` - [x] `angular-io > next-angular-io-site`
> **Note 1:** The [`angular-io` Firebase project](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/angular-io/hosting) will be the canonical one, so all sites should be created there. > **Note 2:** There is Firebase project named `v10-angular-io` and therefore we are not allowed to have `v10-angular-io` site. For consistency, all site names should have a `-site` suffix (i.e. `-angular-io-site`).
2. **What Firebase projects/sites will be obsolete (and can be deleted **at the very end**)?** - [ ] `v2-angular-io` - [ ] `v4-angular-io` - [ ] `v5-angular-io` - [ ] `v6-angular-io` - [ ] `v7-angular-io` - [ ] `v8-angular-io` - [ ] `aio-staging` (including `aio-staging > v9-angular-io`)
3. **What DNS/Firebase redirects do we need?** - [ ] `v2.angular.io` --> `angular-io > v2-angular-io-site` (previously `v2-angular-io`) - [ ] `v4.angular.io` --> `angular-io > v4-angular-io-site` (previously `v4-angular-io`) - [ ] `v5.angular.io` --> `angular-io > v5-angular-io-site` (previously `v5-angular-io`) - [ ] `v6.angular.io` --> `angular-io > v6-angular-io-site` (previously `v6-angular-io`) - [ ] `v7.angular.io` --> `angular-io > v7-angular-io-site` (previously `v7-angular-io`) - [ ] `v8.angular.io` --> `angular-io > v8-angular-io-site` (previously `v8-angular-io`) - [ ] `v9.angular.io` --> `angular-io > v9-angular-io-site` (previously `aio-staging > v9-angular-io`) - [ ] `www.angular.io` --> `angular.io` --> `angular-io > v10-angular-io-site` (previously `angular-io`) - [ ] `rc.angular.io` --> `angular-io > rc-angular-io-site` (previously `-`) - [ ] `next.angular.io` --> `angular-io > next-angular-io-site` (previously `aio-staging`)
4. **What existing projects/sites need to be cloned (and where to)?** - [x] `v2-angular-io` --> `angular-io > v2-angular-io-site` - [x] `v4-angular-io` --> `angular-io > v4-angular-io-site` - [x] `v5-angular-io` --> `angular-io > v5-angular-io-site` - [x] `v6-angular-io` --> `angular-io > v6-angular-io-site` - [x] `v7-angular-io` --> `angular-io > v7-angular-io-site` - [ ] (`v8-angular-io` --> `angular-io > v8-angular-io-site` - will be deployed when we update the merge scripts) - [ ] (`aio-staging > v9-angular-io` --> `angular-io > v9-angular-io-site` - will be deployed when we update the merge scripts) - [ ] (`angular-io` --> `angular-io > v10-angular-io-site` - will be deployed when we update the merge scripts) - [ ] (`aio-staging` --> `angular-io > rc-angular-io-site` - will be deployed when we update the merge scripts) - [ ] (`aio-staging` --> `angular-io > next-angular-io-site` - will be deployed when we update the merge scripts)
5. **What branches need to be updated for future deployements (all active LTS and releasable branches)?** - [ ] `8.2.x` (for https://v8.angular.io/) - [ ] `9.1.x` (for https://v9.angular.io/) - [ ] `10.1.x` (for https://angular.io/) - [ ] `11.0.x` (for https://rc.angular.io/) - [ ] `master` (for https://next.angular.io/) --- ## Execution - [x] **1.** Create the necessary projects/sites. - [ ] **2.** Manually re-upload latest minor versions of all (non-releasable) majors to sites. ([Version cloning](https://firebase.googleblog.com/2020/10/preview-channels-firebase-hosting.html)) _I cloned the version (using `firebase hosting:clone`), but it seems to only clone the content and not the hosting config. Looking for another way to address that (hopefully without having to build each version from the sources 😱)._ - [ ] **3.** Create PRs for all necessary branches to deploy to both locations (old project + new site). - [ ] **4.** Create follow-up PRs to deploy only to sites. - [ ] **5.** Merge PRs from step (3). - [ ] **6.** Verify sites work (for merged PRs and manually cloned versions). - [ ] **7.** Update DNS/Firebase redirects. - [ ] **8.** Merge PRs from step (4). - [ ] **9.** Verify all versions have been successfully deployed to sites (by looking at the deployed SHA in the footer). - [ ] **10.** Verify sub-domains work and point to sites (by looking at the deployed SHA in the footer). - [ ] **11.** Delete unnecessary projects/sites.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[docs-infra] Update angular.io deployments to match new versioning/branching process" (#39366)

Issues.Title: ComponentRef<T> onDestroyed() callback does not get called
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/core ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: Pre-Ivy or if you disable Ivy ### Description **Problem: ComponentRef.onDestroyed callback does not get called** A component gets dynamically created via `ComponentFactoryResolver`. It is then inserted into the view. ```typescript @ViewChild("anchor", { read: ViewContainerRef }) anchor: ViewContainerRef; ``` ```typescript this.compRef = this.cfr .resolveComponentFactory(DynamicComponent) .create(this.injector); this.compRef.onDestroy(() => console.log("DynamicComponent onDestroyed callback") ); this.anchor.insert(this.compRef.hostView); ``` As you can see, the `onDestroyed` callback is attached. If the component gets destroyed by its ComponentRef, the callback **gets called correctly** like so: ```typescript this.compRef.destroy(); ``` if the component gets destroyed by clearing the `anchor`, the callback **does not get called**: ```typescript this.anchor.clear(); ``` As far as I can tell, the `onDestroyed` callback **ONLY** gets called when the component gets destroyed by its `ComponentRef`. Whenever the component gets destroyed by clearing parent views or navigating away or data binding, the callback does not get called. It works in NG 8.2.14 and it works if you set `enableIvy: false` in tsconfig.json. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction [https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-ev4v2y](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-ev4v2y) ## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 10.1.6
Node: 12.18.1
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 10.1.5
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... platform-webworker, router
Ivy Workspace: No

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1001.6
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1001.6
@angular-devkit/core            10.1.6
@angular-devkit/schematics      10.1.6
@angular/cdk                    10.2.4
@angular/cli                    10.1.6
@angular/material               10.2.4
@schematics/angular             10.1.6
@schematics/update              0.1001.6
rxjs                            6.6.3
typescript                      4.0.3

## One difference I have found between Windows and Linux is that on Windows Rollup is looking for the exports in `node_modules/@angular/compiler/index.js`, while on Linux it is looking in `node_modules/@angular/compiler/index.mjs` (notice the `.js` vs `.mjs` extension). The reason is that on Windows `bazel` does not generate any `.mjs` files (e.g. `compiler/index.mjs`) as happens on Linux and Rollup falls back to `.js` files (which are in AMD format, where Rollup cannot read exports from).

Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): capture UMD/CommonJS inner class implementation nodes correctly
Issues.Body:
Previously, UMD/CommonJS class inline declarations of the form:

```ts
exports.Foo = (function() { function Foo(); return Foo; })();
```

were capturing the whole IIFE as the implementation, rather than
the inner class (i.e. `function Foo() {}` in this case). This caused
the interpreter to break when it was trying to access such an export,
since it would try to evaluate the IIFE rather than treating it as a class
declaration.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ngcc): capture UMD/CommonJS inner class implementation nodes correctly" (#39346)

Issues.Title: Add CSS webpack-dev-server HMR when using component styles
Issues.Body:
**I'm submitting a ...**  (check one with "x")

```
[ ] bug report => search github for a similar issue or PR before submitting
[X] feature request
[ ] support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
```

**Current behavior** 

<!-- Describe how the bug manifests. -->

Although the Angular+Webpack docs present the combo as "an excellent alternative to the SystemJS approach", loading component styles via `styles` or `styleUrls` results in a full page refresh, instead of style injection, which occurs when using SystemJS+lite-server.

**Expected behavior**

<!-- Describe what the behavior would be without the bug. -->

A core feature of using Webpack+Webpack-dev-server in development is the availability of Hot Module Replacement. It is expected that HMR would work for css injection regardless of the style loading strategy used. Instead, currently changes to css or scss files which are included in a component's styles result in a full page reload.

**Reproduction of the problem**

<!-- If the current behavior is a bug or you can illustrate your feature request better with an example, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem via https://plnkr.co or similar (you can use this template as a starting point: http://plnkr.co/edit/tpl:AvJOMERrnz94ekVua0u5). -->

**What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?**

<!-- Describe the motivation or the concrete use case -->

Speed up the Angular 2 development process for CSS developers

**Please tell us about your environment:**

<!-- Operating system, IDE, package manager, HTTP server, ... -->
- **Angular version:** 2.0.0
  
  <!-- Check whether this is still an issue in the most recent Angular version -->
- **Browser:** [**_all_** | Chrome XX | Firefox XX | IE XX | Safari XX | Mobile Chrome XX | Android X.X Web Browser | iOS XX Safari | iOS XX UIWebView | iOS XX WKWebView ] 
  
  <!-- All browsers where this could be reproduced -->
- **Language:** [all | **_TypeScript 2.02_** | ES6/7 | ES5]
- **Webpack version:** 1.13.2
- **Webpack-dev-server version:** 1.14.1
- **Node (for AoT issues):** `node --version` =  6.5.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add CSS webpack-dev-server HMR when using component styles" (#39367)

Now I'm running material update and it **PULLS** angular **10**. Issues.Title: ng build and serve have different behaviour in overwriting assets when using assets key in angular.json
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? We did not have to use the assets before as on earlier versions this also worked using `fileReplacements`, and that worked correctly in both `ng serve` and `ng build`. This sounds a little like #16670 ### Description When using the `assets` key in the `angular.json` file, and having a rule that overlaps: ``` "assets": [ "src/favicon.ico", "src/assets", { "input": "src/assets-replace", "output": "/assets", "glob": "**/*" } ] ``` The files from `src/assets-replace` will overwite the files in `src/assets` when using `ng build`, but it does not when using `ng serve`. We use this functionality to have different themes of our own app. We use a different configuration for each theme, and have files with the same filename to replace the original logo, like the logo. This not working makes it a little hard to test whether theme changes work correctly. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction - Change `angular.json`, see assets example above. - Add an `image.png` in your assets folder, and display/show it in a component - Add an `assets-replace` folder in your `src` folder and put another `image.png` in it - Execute `ng serve` and see that it will display the image from `src/assets` - Execute `ng build` and see that it will display the image from `src/assets-replace` Example repro repo: https://github.com/jerbob92/angular-cli-assets-overwrite-bug ## 🌍 Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 10.1.7
Node: 12.19.0
OS: linux x64

Issues.Title: Angular 7 : lazy loading compilation does not generate chunks without a force load.
Issues.Body:
In my application , lazy loading was perfectly working in Angular 4  . However , after I migrated to Angular 7 , the lazy loading and routing has stopped working when I use ng serve.

The routes for the application are defined in `app.module.ts` like this  :

			    RouterModule.forRoot([
				  { path: 'info/:gitCode/:pemCode/:getRtComponent', component: RedComponent },
				  { path: 'info/:gitCode/:pemCode/:getFaq/:getRtComponent', component: RedComponent },
				  { path: 'loadGuardsInfo/:gitCode/:pemCode/:getRtComponent', component: RedComponent },
				  { path: 'loadGuardsInfo/:getRtComponent', component: RedComponent },
				  { path: 'recDet', component: RecDetComponent },
				  { path: 'SlaveComponent/:pfScreen', loadChildren: './ally/slave/slave.module#SlaveModule' },
				  { path: 'MasterComponent/:pfScreen', loadChildren: './ally/master/master.module#MasterModule' },
				  { path: 'DashedComponent/:pfScreen', loadChildren: './ally/dashed/dashed.module#DashedModule' }
				  ])
			  ],
			  providers: [ReqService, { provide: APP_BASE_HREF, useValue: './' }, {
				provide: ErrorHandler,
				useClass: GlobalErrorHandler
			  }, { provide: LocationStrategy, useClass: HashLocationStrategy }],
			  bootstrap: [AppComponent],
			  exports: []

I have gone through a lot of articles on the internet about this and tried out a lot of things , but none worked . 

When I first try ng serve, I just get 6 chunks : `main.js, polyfills.js, runtime.js, scripts.js, styles.js and vendor.js` along with various typescript errors (I am okay with typescript errors since they are coming up as typescript has been updated from 2.4 to 3.1 and according to me they are expected and can be resolved) . What's strange is : when I now go to the `app.module.ts`, where my routes are mentioned and just try : CONTROL+S by introducing some blank characters using backspace , then all the lazy loading named chunks start showing up in the terminal . This issue is very similar to the issue that was reported by @ceyhunn here : https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/27023#issuecomment-491206139

Also , every lazy loaded  module , has a routing established in it like(e.g. for `SlaveModule`) :

     RouterModule.forChild([
      {path:'', component:SlaveComponent}
     ])

**Before the upgrade :**
[![enter image description here][1]][1]

**After the upgrade :**
[![enter image description here][2]][2]

Can the angular experts here tell me as to what's going wrong and how can I solve these issues ?

  [1]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/2N3We.png
  [2]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/zQrjl.png

I have raised the question in stackoverflow as well, but got no answer : https://stackoverflow.com/questions/64440466/angular-7-why-does-lazy-loading-compilation-does-not-generate-chunks
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular 7 : lazy loading compilation does not generate chunks without a force load. " (#19145)

Issues.Title: bug(Breakpoints): Incorrect upper boundary lead to wrong match result
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://components-issue-r4nh9s.stackblitz.io

Steps to reproduce:
1. change browser size to 960 * 600
2. apply following code
```javascript
this.breakpointObserver.observe(Breakpoints.Handset).subscribe((result) => {
    this.isHandset = result.matches;
});
```
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

matching result should be false

#### Actual Behavior

matching result is true


#### Environment

- Angular: 7, 8, 9, 10
- CDK/Material: 7, 8, 9, 10
- Browser(s): Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge
- Operating System: Windows, macOS, Ubuntu

#### How to fix

If we take a look at [Bootstrap](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/blob/v4.4.1/scss/mixins/_breakpoints.scss)'s source code, we can see that, their upper boundary is using numbers like xxx.98, while in [Angular Material](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/10.2.x/src/cdk/layout/breakpoints.ts), the upper boundary is using numbers like xxx.99, and this lead to the bug.
I take size 960*600 as example, in browser, if you match something like
```javascript
'(max-width: 599.99px) and (orientation: portrait), ' +
 '(max-width: 959.99px) and (orientation: landscape)'
```
browser will give you true, only if you match something like
```javascript
'(max-width: 599.98px) and (orientation: portrait), ' +
 '(max-width: 959.98px) and (orientation: landscape)'
```
browser will give you false
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Breakpoints): Incorrect upper boundary lead to wrong match result" (#20850)

…imal values (#20760)"

This reverts commit 19f5f5ca398809011bad1edca061dd0a3004e235.

Reverting this for two reasons:
* the truthiness check is a bit too broad, preventing someone
  from setting the empty string or zero
* I'd prefer to have the input named `valuetext` rather than `aria-valuetext`
  since it's potentially confusing without supporting the `attr.`
  (I know we do this elsewhere, but I'd like to avoid more use of
  this pattern)

cc @crisbeto

Issues.Title: bug(Dialog Overlay): a11y screen reader issue reading overlay content in dialog
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction
This issue can be reproduced on the dialog example: https://material2-dev.firebaseapp.com/select 

Steps to reproduce:
1. Navigate to Dialog
2. Use the Voice Over (mac screen reader) and open the select drop-down
3. Try to navigate the option with UP/DOWN arrow key. The VO navigation doesn't select the options
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
- Using VO is in safari, DOWN/UP arrow navigation should read/announce the select option.


#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
The screen reader does read the selected options in the select component inside the dialog model. 

Relate Issue: https://github.com/angular/components/pull/20695

#### Environment

- Angular: 9+
- CDK/Material: CDK
- Browser(s): Safari
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS

GIF: http://www.giphy.com/gifs/ZGTv8ZW9I2UtXYOD0x
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Dialog Overlay): a11y screen reader issue reading overlay content in dialog" (#20840)

Issues.Title: bug(COMPONENT): mat-tab-group. when the mode is RTL the animation still working as a LTR mode !
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

StackBlitz to get my issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-yxyjcs?file=src/app/example-component.html

Steps to reproduce:
1. move between the tabs by clicking on it, you will find the animation way from left to right not right to left...
2. move between the tabs using the arrows, unacceptable behavior happens... 

#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
The animation should be from right to left when the RTL mode is active.
Pagination Arrow is not working correctly.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
the animation way from left to right in the RTL mode.
unacceptable behavior happens, when using pagination arrow... 

#### Environment

- Angular: **latest**
- CDK/Material: **latest**
- Browser(s): **chrome**
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(COMPONENT): mat-tab-group. when the mode is RTL the animation still working as a LTR mode !" (#20838)

Issues.Title: feat(cdk-row, mat-row): Allow with `a` elements
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Allow `cdk-row` to be used on an `a` element (and maybe other elements as well).

`a[cdk-row]`


#### Use Case

Allowing rows to be anchor tags would help with accessibility, since currently developers [use JavaScript](https://stackoverflow.com/a/53765608/5253155) to mimic links.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(cdk-row, mat-row): Allow with `a` elements" (#20833)

Issues.Title: add remove API to MDC chip harness
Issues.Body:
This allows MDC chips to be removed in testing environments.

Note that the harness must not only click on the remove button, but also dispatch a `transitionend` event. Without the dispatch of this event, the chip would not fire it's `removed` output.

This PR also includes a basic MDC ChipRemoveHarness that mirrors the non-MDC version. This was necessary to find the ChipRemove button in the chip harness' `remove` method.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "add remove API to MDC chip harness" (#20831)

Issues.Title: feat(material-experimental/mdc-chips): Allow custom role for chip set
Issues.Body:
The default mat-chip-set role is 'presentation' if chips are
present, and null if there are no chips. Some users want to
specify custom roles, in particular 'list' (they would use
'listitem' for the chips, which have no default role).
Currently this isn't possible, because mat-chip-set overwrites
their custom role with 'presentation'. Add an Input to allow a
custom role.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(material-experimental/mdc-chips): Allow custom role for chip set" (#20829)

Issues.Title: build: drop typescript 3.9 checks
Issues.Body:
Removes the TypeScript 3.9 checks since the framework is in the process of removing support (see https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/39313).

Also updates the Firebase functions to TS 4.0.

**Note:** this is merge-safe since it only changes build-related code.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: drop typescript 3.9 checks" (#20827)

Issues.Title: Align MDC-based chip harnesses with existing MatChipHarness
